abstract: The architect of the G.O.P. proposal neglects one detail, an economist writes: it indexes coverage increases to overall consumer prices, not health-care costs, which could shift a growing burden to beneficiaires.
snippet: The architect of the G.O.P. proposal neglects one detail, an economist writes: it indexes coverage increases to overall consumer prices, not health-care costs, which could shift a growing burden to beneficiaires.
lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton. He has some financial interests in the health care field.

headline.main: Comparing Ryan’s Medicare Plan to What Congress Gets
